title.rendered: The Ultimate Guide to Ziplining Near Denver

content.rendered:
Written by Amber Boutwell, Marketing Manager
Read more about our authors here.

 

What to Expect for the 2025 Zipline Season

 

Colorado’s ziplining season is officially open, and adventure seekers are ready to soar through the Rockies! Whether you’re a first-time flyer or a ziplining pro, now is the perfect time to experience the thrill of Colorado’s top zipline tours.

At AVA Rafting & Zipline, we offer some of the best ziplining experiences near Denver, featuring breathtaking mountain views, adrenaline-pumping speeds, and expert-guided tours. This guide will help you plan your ziplining adventure for 2025, covering the best locations, what to expect, and how to maximize your outdoor fun this season.

Why Zipline in Colorado’s Front Range?

Colorado is home to some of the most scenic and exhilarating zipline courses in the country. If you’re looking for an adventure close to Denver, ziplining in the Front Range is a must-try experience.

🌄 Unbeatable views – Soar above lush forests, deep canyons, and rushing rivers with panoramic views of the Rocky Mountains.
⚡ Thrilling speeds – Reach speeds of up to 40 mph as you race from platform to platform.
🚗 Easy access from Denver – Our zipline courses are just a short drive from the city, making for a perfect half-day or full-day adventure.
🌊 Pairs perfectly with rafting – Want even more adrenaline? Combine ziplining with whitewater rafting for a back-to-back outdoor experience.

What to Expect on Your First Zipline Tour

If it’s your first time ziplining, don’t worry! AVA Rafting & Zipline provides expert-guided tours to ensure a fun, safe, and exhilarating experience. Here’s what you need to know:

🛠 Gear up: You’ll be outfitted with a helmet, harness, and gloves—just wear comfortable clothing and closed-toe shoes.
💡 Safety first: Our trained guides provide step-by-step instructions before you take off.
😎 Get ready for the thrill: The first zipline might feel intimidating, but once you take the leap, you’ll be hooked!
📸 Capture the moment: Bring a GoPro or rent one from us—this is one adventure you’ll want to relive!


Make It a Full Adventure: Ziplining + Rafting Combos

Want to double the excitement? AVA Rafting & Zipline offers combo adventure packages so you can zipline AND go whitewater rafting in one day!

🔥 Popular 2025 Package Deals:

🚣 Idaho Springs Zip + Clear Creek Rafting – Start your day with an epic whitewater rafting trip, then take to the skies on a high-speed zipline course.

🌊 Buena Vista Zip + Browns Canyon Rafting – Experience one of the top-rated rafting runs in the country, then finish the day with a mountaintop zipline adventure.

These combo packages give you the best of both worlds—thrills on land, water, and air!

How to Book Your Zipline Adventure in 2025

🌟 Ready to take flight? Booking is easy!

📅 Visit AVA Rafting & Zipline to secure your spot today!

🚗 Our Zipline Locations:
📍 Idaho Springs: Just 30 minutes from Denver
📍 Buena Vista: About 2.5 hours from Denver

Whether you’re planning an adventure with friends, a family outing, or an unforgettable date, ziplining in Colorado is the perfect way to experience the great outdoors in 2025!

💬 Got questions? Drop a comment below or call (970) 423-7031 to chat with one of our adventure experts.

🌲⚡ See you in the treetops!

Best Time to Go Ziplining in Colorado

Colorado’s ziplining season typically runs from spring through fall, but the best time to go depends on what kind of experience you’re looking for.

🌷 Spring (March – May) – Cooler temperatures, fewer crowds, and snow-capped mountain views. A great time for those who want a more peaceful adventure.
☀️ Summer (June – August) – Peak season with the best weather! Longer days and warm temperatures make it ideal for combining ziplining with rafting. Book early, as summer weekends fill up fast.
🍂 Fall (September – October) – Stunning autumn foliage and crisp mountain air make fall one of the most scenic times to zipline in Colorado. Plus, fewer tourists mean shorter wait times!

If you’re visiting from out of state, keep in mind that Colorado’s weather can change quickly—layered clothing is always a good idea for ziplining adventures!

What to Bring for Your Zipline Adventure

To make the most of your experience, here’s a checklist of what to bring:

✔️ Comfortable, weather-appropriate clothing – Shorts and t-shirts in summer, long sleeves in spring/fall
✔️ Closed-toe shoes – Sneakers or hiking shoes with good grip (no sandals or flip-flops!)
✔️ Sunscreen & sunglasses – The sun is strong at higher elevations
✔️ Light gloves (optional) – Helpful in cooler months for added comfort
✔️ GoPro or smartphone – Many courses allow you to attach a camera to your helmet to capture the experience
✔️ Water bottle – Stay hydrated before and after your tour

Most zipline tours provide helmets, harnesses, and gloves, so you don’t need to bring any special gear. Just show up ready for an unforgettable adventure!

Don’t Miss Our Deals & Discounts!

If you love adventure but also love saving money, be sure to check out AVA Rafting & Zipline’s Deals Page before booking your trip. We regularly offer seasonal discounts, group rates, and adventure package deals that let you experience more for less.

💰 Some of our most popular deals include:

  • Early-season discounts – Book in the spring and save!
  • Group rates – The more, the merrier—perfect for family outings, corporate retreats, and bachelor/bachelorette parties.
  • Raft & Zip Packages – Bundle your ziplining tour with a whitewater rafting trip for the ultimate Colorado adventure at a discounted rate.
  • Weekday specials – If you have flexibility, booking mid-week can sometimes score you extra savings!

👉 Visit our Deals Page before booking to see the latest offers!

Best Places to Eat After Ziplining in Buena Vista & Idaho Springs

After an adrenaline-pumping zipline adventure, you’re bound to work up an appetite! Here are some top-rated local restaurants near our zipline courses to refuel and relax.

Where to Eat in Idaho Springs 🍔🍺

📍 Beau Jo’s Colorado Style Pizza – A must-visit! Famous for its thick, honey-drizzled crust and hearty mountain pies. Perfect for a post-zipline feast!
📍 Tommyknocker Brewery & Pub – Local craft beer and delicious pub food, including bison burgers and fish & chips. Great for groups!
📍 Smokin’ Yards BBQ – Some of the best BBQ in Colorado! Try their brisket, burnt ends, or smoked mac & cheese.

Where to Eat in Buena Vista 🌮☕

📍 House Rock Kitchen – Healthy, fast-casual options like grass-fed burgers, grain bowls, and fresh salads—perfect for refueling after an adventure.
📍 Eddyline Brewery & Taproom – Local craft beers with tasty menu options like wood-fired pizzas and gourmet sandwiches.
📍 The Buena Viking – A must-try for burger lovers! This food truck serves epic, locally sourced burgers and fries with unique toppings.

No matter where you go, these local gems will satisfy your post-adventure cravings and complete your Colorado experience!

itemListElement.name: The Ultimate Guide to Ziplining Near Denver

@graph.name: Amber Boutwell
@graph.description: Amber Boutwell is a published Denver photographer who loves capturing nature and food. She shoots with natural light but has a deep love for dark skies. When she’s not on mountaintops chasing the Milky Way, she’s managing the great brands behind AVA and The Outlaw Group as their Marketing Manager. She’s been known to quote Joe Pesci, over-kiss cats, enthusiastically eat cheese, and return pugs. Her motto: “Seek out places where the Wi-Fi is weak, the views are stunning, and don’t forget the snacks.”
